question_sentence: Apple unveiled the iPhone 13 Pro this week. Which is not a new feature of the phone?
Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez made waves at the Met Gala with a dress that included which phrase?
A company announced efforts to bring back which animal from thousands of years ago?
California Gov. Gavin Newsom fended off a recall effort Tuesday. The long list of candidates who ran against him did not include:
In the latest TikTok fitness craze, people are eating which snack before working out?
Which of the following groups has the lowest vaccination rates, according to a new Pew Research Center survey of U.S. adults?
Two-thirds of all giant sequoia grove acreage across the Sierra Nevada burned in wildfires between 2015 and 2020.
Which fast-food chain is testing a 30-day subscription pass?
Republicans are calling Gen. Mark Milley treasonous for doing what during Donald Trump’s last days as president?
choices: Assuring China the U.S. wouldn’t launch a nuclear strike
Calling Afghanistan about the impending withdrawal of U.S. troops

question_sentence: What was the theme of this year’s Met Gala?
What is the name of the new security pact between the UK, US and Australia?
evidence: The historic security pact is aimed at countering the threat of China but threatens to open a rift with France

question_sentence: US intelligence officials this week warned that al-Qaeda could use Afghanistan as a base for attacks on America how soon?
evidence: Lieutenant General Scott Berrier told a security conference that  the current assessment was ‘one to two years for al-Qaeda to build some capability to at least threaten the homeland’

question_sentence: The World Anti-Doping Agency is to review a ban on which drug that led to a US athlete being forced to miss the Tokyo Olympics?
evidence: Sprinter Sha’Carri Richardson missed the Games after testing positive for a chemical found in cannabis, the recreational use of which is legal in 19 US states

question_sentence: Which Asian country is under pressure from the US and other wealthy nations to lift a ban imposed last spring on Covid vaccine exports?
evidence: The Indian government began halting vaccine exports in April as daily new domestic cases of Covid reached global record highs

question_sentence: England’s Chief Medical Officer Chris Whitty has dismissed ‘ridiculous’ claims about Covid vaccines made by which rapper?
evidence: The musician tweeted that a friend of her cousin had been forced to cancel his wedding because ‘his testicles became swollen’ and he ‘became impotent’ after getting the jab

question_sentence: Boris Johnson’s mother passed away this week at the age of 79 following a four-decade battle with which disease?
evidence: Charlotte Johnson Wahl was once described by her prime minister son as his family’s ‘supreme authority’

question_sentence: Scientists are attempting to ‘resurrect’ which prehistoric animal to help reverse the effects of climate change?
evidence: A firm partnering with a Harvard geneticist has raised $15m to try to bring back the Arctic animals, which were wiped out 4,000 years ago. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast

question_sentence: The Joint Committee on Vaccination and Immunisation has recommended that which two Covid jabs should mainly be used in the UK’s initial rollout of booster vaccines?
evidence: The government’s vaccine advisers said that a total of around 30 million people, including all over-50s, should be offered a third dose before winter

question_sentence: Which social media giant has partnered with Ray-Ban to launch a new range of ‘smart glasses’?
evidence: Seven years after the ‘ill-fated’ Google Glass, Facebook is ‘trying its hand at internet-connected smart glasses’ that cost $299 (£166), said euronews

question_sentence: Who is the new secretary of state for housing, communities and local government following Boris Johnson’s long-awaited reshuffle?
evidence: Gove has also been put in charge of Johnson’s ‘levelling up’ agenda

question_sentence: Gavin Newsom will ultimately keep his job as governor after prevailing in a recall election backed by Republican leaders in his state. What state is it?
evidence: Driven by a strong Democratic turnout, California Gov. Gavin Newsom has won a recall election; an effort that cost nearly $276 million and was fueled by partisan anger over his pandemic response.

question_sentence: Disney has made an announcement about the release of all remaining films for the rest of 2021. What have they decided?
choices: all Disney films will debut exclusively in theaters
all Disney films will debut exclusively on the streaming service Disney+
the company has paused the release of all films for the rest of the year
the company will release only animated films for the rest of the year
evidence: Citing growing optimism and confidence among theater-goers, Disney movies will now be shown exclusively in theaters before being added to its streaming service Disney+.

question_sentence: Which portion of the US population has seen a 240% increase of Covid-19 cases since July?
evidence: As more and more children head back to school, and with those under 12 unable to be vaccinated, there has been an exponential increase in child Covid-19 cases across the country, accounting for roughly 29% of all cases reported nationwide.

question_sentence: Secretary of State Antony Blinken appeared before a virtual hearing of the House Foreign Affairs Committee. What was he there to discuss?
evidence: Blinken appeared before the committee to discuss the US’s chaotic and deadly withdrawal from Afghanistan – making him the first Biden administration official to publicly account the situation to Congress.

question_sentence: Which country’s prime minister has ordered the firing of its top prosecutor after it was revealed the prosecutor was pursuing charges against the prime minister in the death of the country’s president?
evidence: Haitian Prime Minister Ariel Henry has ordered the firing of the country’s top prosecutor Bed-Ford Claude. Henry has become a central figure in the investigation into the assassination of Haiti’s President Jovenel Moise.

question_sentence: According to the Kaiser Family Foundation, what was the estimated, preventable cost for treating hospitalized, unvaccinated Covid-19 patients in the US over the last three months alone?
evidence: Using data from the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services, the Kaiser Family Foundation estimates that “preventable” medical costs for unvaccinated Covid-19 patients totaled $5.7 billion.

question_sentence: The US and UK have entered a trilateral partnership with which Pacific power, which includes the provision of nuclear-powered submarines?
evidence: In a trilateral partnership called “AUKUS,” the US and UK will assist Australia in acquiring nuclear-powered submarines, a major step as US President Joe Biden works to counter military and economic challenges from China.

question_sentence: The 2021 MTV Video Music Awards were presented on Sunday. Which singer won Artist of the Year?
evidence: Justin Bieber had seven MTV Music Awards nominations to start the night, and walked away with two awards, including Artist of the Year.

question_sentence: Geneticists at Harvard’s Medical School received a $15 million investment in their efforts to resurrect an extinct species of animal. What are they looking to bring back to life?
evidence: Led by Harvard Medical School’s George Church and backed by genetics company Colossal, the group of scientists are looking to bring back the woolly mammoth, a species that went extinct nearly 4,000 years ago.

question_sentence: Which company has now produced the first, consumer-ready electric pickup truck?
evidence: Rivian is the first electric vehicle manufacturer to bring an electric pickup truck to the market, with the first consumer-ready vehicles rolling off the line and approved for delivery in all 50 states.
